product_description: Durra Panel is a truly sustainable compressed straw panel building material with a 100% straw core.

product_categories.category_name: Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems

recyclable_percentage_description: Durra Panel is 100% biodegradable and can be shredded and used as compost at the end of its useful life.
recyclable_offcuts_description: Durra Panel is 100% biodegradable and can be shredded and used as compost at the end of its useful life.
recycled_content_description:
Durra Panel is primarily made from reclaimed wheat straw, a by-product of annual harvesting.

Visy kraft liner used is made from 100% recycled materials.
reusable_description: Durra Panel and Durra Steel Sections can be used to create modular wall and ceiling systems which are simple to demount and reuse.
end_of_life_program_description: Durra Panel is 100% biodegradable and can be shredded and used as compost at the end of its useful life.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Durra Panel is supplied direct from manufacturing facility to customer, typically no offsite storage required.
minimisation_design_strategy: Durra Panel can provide made to order lengths which avoid waste both during the manufacturing process and cutting onsite.
factory_finished_description: Product is factory finished, ready for immediate installation after delivery.
specific_installation_methods:
To assist in demounting and biodegrading:
- Dry fixing methods are recommended (screw fixings only).
- Avoid toxic paints/coatings.
- Use low VOCs paints or natural sealants such as beeswax.
applied_finish_required_description:
When installing Durra Panel, it’s important to remember that the building envelope must be weathertight before you begin the installation.

Durra Panel wall and ceiling surfaces must be finished with an undercoat sealer immediately after product installation has been completed.
other_comments:
- Durra Panel is made from one of the world's most wasted resources, straw.
- By purchasing this waste material, local farmers receive a secondary source of income and stubble burning is reduced.
- The manufacturing process uses no resins or binding agents, no water or gas and produces zero toxic waste.
- Durra Panel creates healthy indoor air environments, being 99.9% free from VOCs (biophilia).
- Durra Panel sustainably provides acoustic, thermal and fire resistant benefits within the one product.
- Demountable and reusable or 100% biodegradable at end of life.
type_of_packaging: Standard cardboard and plastic wrap is used to protect the product during transport.

product_description: Highly functional and easy to install drop-in ceiling tiles – EPD + Cradle to Cradle certified
standard_dimensions: 1195 x 595mm to fit T-Frame suspended ceiling systems with a nominal 1200 x 600mm grid
recyclable_percentage_description: Ecoustic ceiling tiles can be recycled through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme either on-site or through one of our local third-party recycling partners: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: Ecoustic ceiling tiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recycled_content_description: SCS Certified 60% Post-Consumer Recycled Polyester Staple Fiber Content
recycling_process_description: 100% PET (polyethylene terephthalate) is a mono-material that can be mechanically recycled into pellets or flakes for use in textiles, carpets, and nonwoven materials, or moulded into containers and packaging strapping. It can also be chemically recycled and repolymerised into food-grade PET resin for bottles, containers, or high-quality textile fibres comparable to virgin PET. Australia currently lacks commercial-scale chemical reprocessing facilities for plastics, however, so most PET is downcycled into lower-grade composite materials (e.g. foam).
reusable_description: Ecoustic ceiling tiles are designed for disassembly and reuse, as they do not require adhesive or permanent fixtures and can simply be dropped into new and existing T-Frame ceiling systems. This allows for easy separation of materials at end of product lifecycle.
end_of_life_program_description: Ecoustic ceiling tiles can be returned to Instyle for recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Water is not used in the manufacturing of this product.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Distance from manufacturing plant to the port of the country of origin is 120km. Consolidated shipments, efficient packing and optimised routes are all employed to reduce emissions.
minimisation_design_strategy: Waste, environmental impact and cost can be minimised by designing with substrate panel size in mind. The 1195 x 595mm dimensions are designed to fit perfectly into T-Frame suspended ceiling systems with a nominal 1200 x 600mm grid. The Instyle Ecoustic design team can help with efficient yield component sizes for our panel products.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights risks in PET supply chains arise mainly in the polymer processing stage, where workers can be exposed to harmful VOCs and antimony, a toxic substance used as a catalyst. These conditions necessitate stringent safety measures to protect workers' health and rights. All of Instyle's Ecoustic SC products are free of such risks, as qualified by their Declare and Cradle to Cradle certifications.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: Acoustic PET panels can release microplastics during use and at end of life, posing health & environmental risks. This can be mitigated by returning the product to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
specific_installation_methods: Ecoustic ceiling tiles do not require adhesive or permanent fixtures and can simply be dropped into new and existing T-Frame ceiling systems. Follow the accompanying installation + care guides for installation guidelines that maximise end of life disassembly.
other_comments: Please note that kgCO2eq value varies depending panel thicknesses – an average has been provided. Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.
type_of_packaging: Our circular packaging strategy for Ecoustic products uses 84% recycled cardboard, reusable pallets, and recycled paper. We continuously reduce polymer use, currently limited only to tapes and necessary bagging where no viable sustainable alternative exists.

compostable_conditions: Product is 100% timber, so fully compostable.
minimisation_design_strategy: Layon Sheet size, substrate size, grain direction, Efficient matching options such as random mismatch.
modern_slavery_comments: These requirements are assessed annually as part of our FSC certification process.

applied_finish_required_description: Once pressed onto board and fabricated, the timber veneer will need to be sealed.  There are various options depending on application including but not limited to LOW VOC water based, acrylic-urethane, poly-urethane single and 2 PAC coatings etc.
other_comments:
Sustainable wood veneers have many environmental benefits:
Low embodied energy
Carbon storage – growing trees absorb carbon dioxide which is then “locked up” for the life of the tree and wooden products made from that tree
Land use and biodiversity – Sustainably managed native forests are a natural ecosystem and consequently have high biodiversity. Plantations also support a reasonable degree of biodiversity.
Wood is a renewable resource
Veneer is one of the most environmentally efficient and economical ways to use beautiful timbers because one cubic metre of veneer can cover more than 1,000 m2 of panel surface

The Briggs Group is committed to the responsible use of the world’s resources. We are proud to have pioneered the use of Australian sustainable hardwoods for veneer, harvested in accordance with passing the strict environmental guidelines that are required by Government. By law, Australian State Forest land cannot be permanently cleared; it must always be replanted or regenerated.  Sustainable harvest means that the amount of timber that grows back each year is greater than, or equal to, the amount harvested. Furthermore, such forests are managed in accordance with strict laws and regulations to protect biodiversity, endangered species, water quality and other environmental values.  Additionally, all the Australian veneer that we get sliced, and all the veneer that we import, is checked under our Due Diligence program as being legally harvested.

standard_dimensions: 12mm thickness (+/-1-2mm), Nominal dimensions: 1100x2700mm (See specification for exact dimensions)
recyclable_percentage_description: Ecoustic V Panels can be recycled through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme either on-site or through one of our local third-party recycling partners: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: Ecoustic V Panel offcuts can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recycled_content_description: SCS Certified 60% Post-Consumer Recycled Polyester Staple Fiber Content
recycling_process_description: 100% PET (polyethylene terephthalate) is a mono-material that can be mechanically recycled into pellets or flakes for use in textiles, carpets, and nonwoven materials, or moulded into containers and packaging strapping. It can also be chemically recycled and repolymerised into food-grade PET resin for bottles, containers, or high-quality textile fibres comparable to virgin PET. Australia currently lacks commercial-scale chemical reprocessing facilities for plastics, however, so most PET is downcycled into lower-grade composite materials (e.g. foam).
reusable_description: Ecoustic V Panels are designed for improved dematerialisation. Our panels can be installed using Instyle’s intuitive natural anodised aluminium edging profiles, which reduce the need for excess adhesive and allow for easier separation of materials at end of product lifecycle.
end_of_life_program_description: Ecoustic V Panels can be returned to Instyle for recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Water is not used in the manufacturing of this product.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Consolidated shipments, efficient packing and optimised routes are all employed to reduce emissions.
minimisation_design_strategy: Waste, environmental impact and cost can be minimised by designing with panel size in mind. The Instyle Ecoustic design team can help with efficient yield component sizes for our panel products.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights risks in PET supply chains arise mainly in the polymer processing stage, where workers can be exposed to harmful VOCs and antimony, a toxic substance used as a catalyst. These conditions necessitate stringent safety measures to protect workers' health and rights. All of Instyle's Ecoustic SC products are free of such risks, as qualified by their Declare and Cradle to Cradle certifications.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: Acoustic PET panels can release microplastics during use and at end of life, posing health & environmental risks. This can be mitigated by returning the product to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
specific_installation_methods: Ecoustic V Panels are designed for improved dematerialisation. Our panels can be installed using Instyle’s intuitive natural anodised aluminium edging profiles, which reduce the need for excess adhesive and allow for easier separation of materials at end of product lifecycle. Follow the accompanying installation + care guides for installation guidelines that maximise product longevity.
other_comments: Please note that kgCO2eq value varies depending panel thicknesses – an average has been provided. Refer to EPD for full breakdown. Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.
type_of_packaging: Our circular packaging strategy for Ecoustic products uses 84% recycled cardboard, reusable pallets, and recycled paper. We continuously reduce polymer use, currently limited only to tapes and necessary bagging where no viable sustainable alternative exists.

recyclable_offcuts_description: Ecoustic panel offcuts can be returned to Instyle for recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
recycling_process_description: 100% PET (polyethylene terephthalate) is a mono-material that can be mechanically recycled into pellets or flakes for use in textiles, carpets, and nonwoven materials, or moulded into containers and packaging strapping. It can also be chemically recycled and repolymerised into food-grade PET resin for bottles, containers, or high-quality textile fibres comparable to virgin PET. Australia currently lacks commercial-scale chemical reprocessing facilities for plastics, however, so most PET is downcycled into lower-grade composite materials (e.g. foam).
reusable_description: Ecoustic panels are designed for improved dematerialisation. Our panels can be installed using Instyle’s intuitive natural anodised aluminium edging profiles, which reduce the need for excess adhesive and allow for easier separation of materials at end of product lifecycle.
end_of_life_program_description: Ecoustic panels can be returned to Instyle for recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Water is not used in the manufacturing of this product.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: The A4 module is not declared, however local manufacturing, consolidated shipments, efficient packing and optimised routes are all employed to reduce emissions.
minimisation_design_strategy: Waste, environmental impact and cost can be minimised by designing with panel size in mind. For example, if the panel is 1200mm x 2700mm, it is advisable to design components in widths like 300, 400, 600, or 1200mm. The Instyle Ecoustic design team can help with efficient yield component sizes for our panel products.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights risks in PET supply chains arise mainly in the polymer processing stage, where workers can be exposed to harmful VOCs and antimony, a toxic substance used as a catalyst. These conditions necessitate stringent safety measures to protect workers' health and rights. These risks are minimised due to strict Australia labour laws, and as qualified by the product's Declare and Global Greentag Level A certifications.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: Acoustic PET panels can release microplastics during use and at end of life, posing health & environmental risks. This can be mitigated by returning the product to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
specific_installation_methods: Ecoustic panels are designed for improved dematerialisation. Our panels can be installed using Instyle’s intuitive natural anodised aluminium edging profiles, which reduce the need for excess adhesive and allow for easier separation of materials at end of product lifecycle. Follow the accompanying installation + care guides for installation guidelines that maximise product longevity.
other_comments: Please note that kgCO2eq value varies depending panel thicknesses – an average has been provided. Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.
type_of_packaging: Our circular packaging strategy for Ecoustic products uses 84% recycled cardboard, reusable pallets, and recycled paper. We continuously reduce polymer use, currently limited only to tapes and necessary bagging where no viable sustainable alternative exists.

recyclable_percentage_description: Ecoustic panels can be recycled through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme either on-site or through one of our local third-party recycling partners: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: Ecoustic panel offcuts can be returned to Instyle for recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
recycling_process_description: 100% PET (polyethylene terephthalate) is a mono-material that can be mechanically recycled into pellets or flakes for use in textiles, carpets, and nonwoven materials, or moulded into containers and packaging strapping. It can also be chemically recycled and repolymerised into food-grade PET resin for bottles, containers, or high-quality textile fibres comparable to virgin PET. Australia currently lacks commercial-scale chemical reprocessing facilities for plastics, however, so most PET is downcycled into lower-grade composite materials (e.g. foam).
reusable_description: Ecoustic panels are designed for improved dematerialisation. Our panels can be installed using Instyle’s intuitive natural anodised aluminium edging profiles, which reduce the need for excess adhesive and allow for easier separation of materials at end of product lifecycle.
end_of_life_program_description: Ecoustic panels can be returned to Instyle for recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Designs are screenprinted using non-hazardous , water-based GOTS-certified Permaset inks. These formulations reduce potable water use as they require less water for washing and involve recycling and treating water to minimise fresh water demand. Water is not used in the manufacturing of panel substrate.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: The A4 module is not declared, however local manufacturing, consolidated shipments, efficient packing and optimised routes are all employed to reduce emissions.
minimisation_design_strategy: Waste, environmental impact and cost can be minimised by designing with panel size in mind. For example, if the panel is 1200mm x 2700mm, it is advisable to design components in widths like 300, 400, 600, or 1200mm. The Instyle Ecoustic design team can help with efficient yield component sizes for our panel products.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights risks in PET supply chains arise mainly in the polymer processing stage, where workers can be exposed to harmful VOCs and antimony, a toxic substance used as a catalyst. These conditions necessitate stringent safety measures to protect workers' health and rights. These risks are minimised due to strict Australia labour laws, and as qualified by the product's Declare and Global Greentag Level A certifications.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: Acoustic PET panels can release microplastics during use and at end of life, posing health & environmental risks. This can be mitigated by returning the product to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
specific_installation_methods: Ecoustic panels are designed for improved dematerialisation. Our panels can be installed using Instyle’s intuitive natural anodised aluminium edging profiles, which reduce the need for excess adhesive and allow for easier separation of materials at end of product lifecycle. Follow the accompanying installation + care guides for installation guidelines that maximise product longevity.
other_comments: Please note that kgCO2eq value varies depending panel thicknesses – an average has been provided. Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.
type_of_packaging: Our circular packaging strategy for Ecoustic products uses 84% recycled cardboard, reusable pallets, and recycled paper. We continuously reduce polymer use, currently limited only to tapes and necessary bagging where no viable sustainable alternative exists.

end_of_life_program_description:
Products reach the end of their product life cycle for several reasons. Decor Systems recognises that end-of-life milestones are often key to maintaining environmental sustainability initiatives.

With that in mind, we have set out below our End of Product Lifecycle Policy which aims to dually maintain the ongoing sustainability of our products and simultaneously support school facilities in areas that are designated in lower socio-economic regions.

If our acoustic panel systems attain their end of life due to building demolition or refurbishment, Decor Systems commits to donating usable panels to educational facilities (schools, training centres, childcare, etc.) in regions identified as having a high proportion of students with learning challenges.

Special consideration is given to centres that focus on literacy programs for Indigenous students.

The following conditions apply:

Liaise with Decor Systems to determine suitability before panels are returned. Photos will be required both before and after dismantling to ascertain suitability.
Panels to be dismantled and returned to Decor Systems at the client’s cost.
Panels must be in reasonable condition in their original manufactured sizes.
The final decision will rest with Decor Systems as to the suitability of the panels for re-deployment to alternative projects.
minimisation_design_strategy: Decor Systems offers free shop drawings to ensure accurate site measurement and minimal wastage. We also offer a site measurement service using the latest technology for added accuracy.
modern_slavery_comments:
Decor Systems is committed to ethical business practices and the eradication of modern slavery in all its forms. We firmly believe in upholding human rights, promoting social responsibility, and maintaining transparency in our operations and supply chains. This Modern Slavery Statement outlines our approach to combating modern slavery and human trafficking, the steps we have taken to prevent its occurrence, and our plans for continuous improvement.

INTRODUCTION
This is the second Modern Slavery Statement submitted by Decor Systems. Decor Systems has elected to publish this statement voluntarily, as informed by the Modern Slavery Act 2018.

The purpose of this statement is to outline the business’ systems for identifying the risk of modern slavery in our operations and supply chain and implementing processes to minimise any risk.

Decor Systems recognise that slavery and human trafficking can occur in many forms including forced labour, child labour, human trafficking, forced marriage and deceptive methods of recruiting labour.

Decor Systems are committed to operating responsibly and maintaining ethical standards across our operations, with a particular focus on risk areas within our supply chain.

STRUCTURE
Decor Systems is a family owned Australian owned and operated vertically integrated manufacturer, supplier and retailer of architectural acoustic panel systems.

Our headquarters, manufacturing and supply facility located in Glendenning, NSW. Decor Systems maintains offices in Brisbane and Melbourne.

OPERATIONS AND SUPPLY CHAINS
Decor Systems is committed to the superior design, production and supply of quality products and services. We have been in the business for over 50 years and offer an extensive range of innovative products, professional services, experience, and industry knowledge.

With a growing team of Sales and Project Consultants located throughout Australia, , a modern manufacturing and supply facility and an international sourcing team, Decor Systems has a valued reputation for reliably delivering state-of-the-art architectural solutions.

Decor Systems’ supply chain includes both local and overseas suppliers with whom the business has established, long-standing supply agreements in place.

Our manufacturing facility produces custom and made-to-order products, sourcing raw materials and componentry from tier one suppliers mostly located in Australia.

Our importing division sources and assembles materials that requires little or no customisation, with raw materials sourced largely from suppliers located in Germany, USA and Latvia, as well as some local Australian suppliers.

ADDRESSING THE RISK OF MODERN SLAVERY PRACTICES
The Decor Systems executive team are committed to ethical procurement and oppose slavery in all its forms.

Policies and risk management processes have been implemented to identify and address the risk of modern slavery in our supply chain. This includes routine supplier evaluation and supply chain mapping that encompasses a range of environmental and ethical risks, including modern slavery.

Within this supply chain analysis, BFX has identified two areas of risk. First, a generally low risk of modern slavery in the construction supplies sector. Second, some second-tier suppliers where materials are imported from overseas have a medium geographic and entity risk.

DUE DILIGENCE AND REMEDIATION PROCESSES
To date, Decor Systems has had no reported incidents of modern slavery or breaches by its overseas suppliers.

Nevertheless, Decor Systems recognises the inherent risk of slavery and human trafficking within the supply chain and has established internal processes to guide supplier selection and tendering, including:

Consideration of certain factors before a supplier is awarded a supply contract. For example, the potential supplier’s reputation, ability to supply, integrity, financial strength and compliance with legislation and best practice.
Ensuring that Decor Systems do not purchase materials from suppliers that breach the UN Guiding Principles. If any existing suppliers are found to have breached the UN Guiding Principles, Decor Systems will take immediate steps to reassess those supply arrangements.
Staff training within Decor Systems direct supply chain,in which supplier evaluation is conducted prior to engagement of suppliers.
Existing suppliers are audited in line with Decor Systems GECA, FSC and Illegal Logging Audit requirements.
FUTURE COMMITMENTS
Over the next year, Decor Systems focus areas will be:

Further refining our procurement processes and training our procurement team with best practice initiatives.
Reviewing identified risk areas in the supply chain and reporting to the Decor Systems board.
David Faulkes
Chief Executive Officer
